intro: Dipteranthemum, commonly known as the African snowball, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plants are characterized by their showy, clustered white or pink flowers that resemble snowballs, hence the common name. They are typically shrubs or subshrubs with upright growth habits. Dipteranthemum species are often cultivated for their ornamental value and ability to tolerate drought conditions.
